body:
New here, not sure re: the typical protocol...
Something like this work?
![discoverymenu](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16848469/12528577/cffd98ec-c168-11e5-9476-aaa43ce7d9eb.png)

edit: image

I guess you should replace "discovery Server: foo device info:" with just the URL.

edit: Ahh, there you have that long auth string. @calmh: Maybe just use the base url?

I figured 'discovery server' was telling you what server was showing that machine. They're all from different subdomains.
 Doesn't help the end user, but it could be valid either way.

I think this whole thing should be turned into a modal, which when opened has more space to describe the errors.
Same goes for the relays.

Is there enough data to require a modal?  
As far as i can tell, the extent of the errors are 'network is unreachable'. Whether that's because the host is offline, there's a upnp problem, a port isn't forwarded, or there's a firewall blocking it, there isn't anything else being reported to the failed disco array.
Agree, but the errors are too long to fit into a tooltip it seems, hence why its ugly.
What about combing this issue with #2218? Some modal with several connection information in one place.
+1 for a modal, but -1 for combining it with the connection doctor as that's a much larger feature

I am thinking about combining relays + connections + discovery etc into a single modal.
Once temp indexes get merged, I'll work on merging the relays + connections etc which will allow us to drop a row.
I just checked and I cant reproduce it. It seems to be gone. Can someone confirm?

Define cannot reproduce.
If discovery is not failing, you won't see them.
I can reproduce, when I disable ipv6. Thx for help thinking ;)

issue.title: Show discovery errors in modal instead of tooltip (fixes #2344)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

labels.name: pr-merged
labels.description: Legacy label used in the past for pull requests merged to the main tree

issue.body: ### Purpose Previously, the errors relating to discovery were displayed in a tooltip as mentioned in #2344. Apart from being ugly, the errors were could not be copied. This replaces the tooltip with a modal. Text is added to the tooltip to inform the user that clicking the text will show the errors. The errors are displayed as an unordered list inside the modal. Questions: Are the title text and tooltip text ok? Is the red colour with the danger icon appropriate for the modal? ### Testing Tested with different viewport sizes by changing the dimensions of the chrome viewport. Checked if the text in the modal can be copied. ### Screenshots *The new tooltip* *The discovery errors modal*

body: We should be able to translate this "Click to see discovery failures." string

issue.title: gui, script: Translate discovery popover and detect it in translate script

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

labels.name: pr-merged
labels.description: Legacy label used in the past for pull requests merged to the main tree

issue.body:
The popover text for discovery failures wasn't translated. Thanks @bugith for noticing and [notifying about this](https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/issues/2344#issuecomment-289193071).
The translate.go script did not pick these up as untranslated, so I added this case such that one gets notified if this happens again in the future.
